ack.title: ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
ack.p: We would like to thank Sam Droege for identifying our specimens and for sharing his profound knowledge on native bees. We are thankful to Ernst Conservation Seeds for sponsoring the seed mixes for this study. We specially thank Mark Fiely at Ernst Conservation Seeds for assistance in plant selection and plant handling. We are further grateful to Kevin Conover and his crew at the Beltsville research farm for helping us with finding and preparing plots and for taking good care of the experimental sites. N. Seitz would like to thank the entire UMD bee laboratory for hosting her so kindly and facilitating the research in many different ways. We finally thank two anonymous reviewers for their constructive comments which were very helpful when revising our manuscript. This work was supported by the Explorers Club through the Exploration Fund Grant/Mamont Scholar program. Furthermore, the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD) awarded Nicola Seitz a PhD scholarship for the research stay abroad, and the University of Würzburg awarded N. Seitz a Scientia PhD scholarship funded by the Bavarian Gender Equality Grant of the Bavarian State Ministry of Science. N. Seitz was also supported by a grant of the German Excellence Initiative to the Graduate School of Life Sciences, University of Würzburg. The funding sources had no involvement in the study design; in the collection, analysis, and interpretation of the data; and in the writing of the report. Open access funding enabled and organized by Projekt DEAL.
